data.title: Fascinating
data.text: What a great way to learn about Racine history. Lived here my whole life and was amazed at what I learned there. It is a must visit for adults as well as kids. Learn something new every time I visit.

data.title: Free history lesson!
data.text: We saw the museum when driving by and decided to check it out. Hello! It is free!!! What else is free anymore? We were amazed by the well done exhibits about the area. Things were covered from immigrants to the underground railroad through the growth of industry. It is surprising to see how much Racine has contributed to the world. Think Case and SC Johnson to drop a couple of names. Definitely worth a look if you're in the area and like history.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: This is a nice small place with friendly librarians that helped my wife with genealogy research.... It was a pain finding parking on the street however...

data.title: Small
data.text: This is a small, freemuseum. It has some interesting exhibits. It is laid out in a fairly confusing way and the quality of the exhibits varies widely. However it is free and right across from the parking garage!

data.title: Racine Local History
data.text: An interesting place for searching out and learning local history. Archives of Racine life in the past with facts about the community. Admission was free, but parking close by is not. A small museum that is clean and easy to walk through, usually not crowded, which is a plus in my opinion.There are Racine themed gifts for sale The staff is pleasant and helpful. A great place to see Racine history for all ages.

data.title: Nice, small local museum.
data.text: Small museum about Racine, lots of interesting facts about area. Free. Had to pay to park on street.

data.title: Bring the kids and go back in time
data.text: I have passed this museum hundreds of times and never went in. From the outside it looks like an old church. When I went inside I was amazed. Three floors of exhibits to see and interact with. My children enjoy the conversations that the volunteers will engage you in. They are very knowledgeable and are so glad you stopped in to see them. I was very surprised. Several times a year they have special activities for children. At Halloween ,there was a scavenger hunt to find things in the museum. Located 1 1/2 blocks east of Lake Michigan you can take a walk to see the harbor, Laurel Clark water fountain (great for kids to cool off in), Lake Michigan and the library. Situated at the end of the main street shopping district you will find many shops, restaurants and the RAM (Racine Art Museum) all within a short walk.

data.title: All racinians should visit
data.text: Easy to get thru, good history of Racine, great archives, unique Racine gifts, And the exhibits change every so often. Great sports memorabilia, including the Racine Belles.

data.title: Nice little museum in Racine
data.text:
The museum is small but full of artifacts, stories, and photos of Racine's history. The staff and volunteers are very welcoming and friendly. I really enjoyed the Civil War exhibit, and in particular, the touch-screen interactive fugitive slave story, in which guests try to make it to Canada, in a "choose your own adventure"-style challenge.

The museum recently opened an exhibit on the city's sports history, which was nicely put together. I wish there were more information about the Hellenistic-era mummy-- which was the most intriguing and unexpected artifact of the collection.

data.title: Racines colorful past on display
data.text: The staff of this museum does a great job of highlighting different elements of a colorful city on the lake.   Displays include the Civil War, sports, manufacturing history and more.  Located downtown, it is convenient, inexpensive and has some changing exhibits.  Located between Chicago and Milwaukee, Racine has a history of significant and surprising events.  Treat yourself to a visit.

data.title: Racine Heritage Museum is a gem
data.text: Focus on Frank Lloyd Wright, the Racine Sports Hall of Fame and Racine Industrial and Manufacturing innovation. Hard to park and lots of stairs but friendly staff and great archives.

data.title: Well worth a visit for interesting historical Information
data.text: Racine Heritage Museum is dedicated to preserving the material culture and telling the special stories of the people of Racine County; their achievements, diversity, inventive genius, productivity, craftsmanship and entrepreneurial spirit.  It includes a unique look a from Racine County's Underground Railroad to Racine's connection to the Challenger disaster.  Also, the Archive for a wealth of local history and Genealogy.
